messages.messageBody:
nooooooo, I've USED OO for years to cook w/ and yes, I prefer *from* not *pkg*, as well ...
 
Pris
----- Original Message -----
From: Michelle Harper
To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
Sent: Sunday, June 25, 2000 10:26 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re:Olive oil

Priss, I use extra virgin Olive Oil from Italy(not packaged in Italy) for everything...Olive really isn't that overbearing, scentwise, in my opinion.  medicine to muffins...p.s...i do use real butter for baking.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re:Olive oil
messages.msgSnippet: ... Oooooo! Speaking of olive oil .... we went on an *adventure* to a store in a neighbouring town. It was their 85 anniversary (no cost field trip except for
messages.messageBody:
> Michelle Harper wrote:
>
> Priss, I use extra virgin Olive Oil from Italy(not packaged in Italy)
> for everything...Olive really isn't that overbearing, scentwise, in my
> opinion. medicine to muffins...p.s...i do use real butter for baking.

Oooooo! Speaking of olive oil .... we went on an *adventure* to a store
in a neighbouring town. It was their 85 anniversary (no cost field trip
except for some goodies I bought there).
It is a tiny little Italian grocery and they were having a big
celebration. They carry all kinds of exotic sauces and wild mushrooms on
occaision and specialty breads from some snooty bakery out Toronto way.
An Epicures dream store: and soooo tiny. It stll looks like and early
1900's store except for the coolers for the veggies.

Well they had olive oi and baguette out for tasting and I fell in love
with one of the brands which I found to my surprise was $25 for about 2
1/2 cups.
Talk about sticker shock. But you really could have sat and dipped bread
all day it was sooo delicious!

I told dh that I want some for Xmas!!!

Buzz
--
